creator: sloan@pobox.com
text:
In Tomcat 6.0.16 if you do the following:

response.sendError(500, "This is my error message")

The statusText read by the browser will be "This is my error message" and the status will be 500.

Something has changed in Tomcat 6.0.18 where the statusText will be the literal string translation of the error code (the status will still be 500).  I.E. the statusText will read "Internal Server Error" instead of "This is my error message".

This occurs for all error code types and is browser independent.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
This is as a result of the fix for CVE-2008-1232.
See http://tomcat.apache.org/security-6.html for the details.

To configure the behavior, see http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-6.0-doc/config/systemprops.html specifcially org.apache.coyote.USE_CUSTOM_STATUS_MSG_IN_HEADER

If you do change this setting you *must* make sure only ISO-8859-1 text is used in the error message.
